    <div style="text-align: left; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold;">ITEM 2.02.&#160; RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL CONDITION</div>

    <div>&#160;</div>

    <div style="text-align: left; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">On April 27, 2023, Newmont Corporation, a Delaware corporation, issued a news release reporting its operating and financial results for the first quarter
      ended March&#160;31, 2023. A copy of the news release is furnished as Exhibit 99.1 to this report.</div>

    <div>&#160;</div>

    <div><br />
    </div>

    <div style="text-align: left; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold;">ITEM 9.01.&#160; FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND EXHIBITS</div>

    <div>
      <div class="bw-release">
        <div class="bw-release">
          <div class="bw-release">
            <h1> <b>Newmont Delivers on First Quarter 2023 Expectations, Remains on Track to Achieve Full Year Guidance; Declares $0.40 First Quarter Dividend</b> </h1>
            <div class="bw-release-body">
              <div class="bw-release-table-js bw-release-story">
                <p>DENVER--(BUSINESS WIRE)--April 27, 2023--Newmont Corporation (NYSE: NEM, TSX: NGT) (Newmont or the Company) today announced first quarter 2023 results and declared a first quarter dividend of $0.40 per share. </p>
                <p> <b>Delivered First Quarter Production as Expected; Improving Production in Second Quarter<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">*</sup></b> </p>
                <ul style="list-style-type: disc;">
                  <li> <b>Produced 1.27 million gold ounces</b> and 288 thousand co-product gold equivalent ounces (GEOs)<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">**</sup> from copper, silver, lead and zinc </li>
                  <li> <b>Reported gold Costs Applicable to Sales (CAS) of $1,025 per ounce and gold All-In Sustaining Costs (AISC) of $1,376 per ounce<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">***</sup>;</b> impacted by lower production volumes and continued global cost pressures; costs
                    expected to decrease throughout the year </li>
                  <li> <b>On track to achieve full-year guidance</b> of between 5.7 and 6.3 million ounces of attributable gold production with Gold AISC between $1,150 and $1,250 per ounce </li>
                  <li> <b>Generated $481 million of cash from continuing operations and reported $(45) million of Free Cash Flow<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">***</sup>;<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;"> </sup></b>impacted by lower production volumes, timing of working capital changes and higher capital
                    spend </li>
                  <li> <b>Reported Net Income of $363 million, with Adjusted Net Income (ANI)<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">***</sup> of $0.40 per share and Adjusted EBITDA<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">***</sup> of $990 million;</b> lower production volumes offset by higher realized gold prices </li>
                  <li> <b>Ended the quarter with $2.7 billion of consolidated cash, $797 million of short-term time deposits and $6.5 billion of liquidity</b>; reported net debt to adjusted EBITDA ratio of 0.6x<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">***</sup> </li>
                  <li> <b>Sold common shares of Triple Flag Precious Metals Corporation for $179 million</b>, further optimizing Newmont's equity portfolio acquired with the Goldcorp transaction in 2019 </li>
                  <li> <b>Published 19<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">th</sup> Annual Sustainability Report and 2<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">nd</sup> Annual Taxes and Royalties Contribution Report</b>, providing a transparent review of Newmont's ESG performance and an overview of Newmont's tax strategy
                    and economic contributions </li>
                </ul>
                <p> <b>First Quarter Dividend Declared Within Established Framework<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">****</sup></b> </p>
                <ul style="list-style-type: disc;">
                  <li> <b>Board of Directors declared a dividend of $0.40 per share of common stock for the first quarter of 2023</b>, payable on June 15, 2023 to holders of record at the close of business on June 1, 2023 </li>
                  <li> <b>Annualized dividend payout range for 2023 of $1.40 to $1.80 per share<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">****</sup></b>; subject to quarterly approval by Board of Directors </li>
                  <li> <b>Based on a</b> <b>sustainable base dividend of $1.00 per share</b> payable at base reserves price <b>and an incremental dividend payout of $0.60 per share;</b> Q1 2023 dividend payout calibrated at the mid-point of the $1,700
                    per ounce annualized payout range </li>
                </ul>
                <p> "Since transforming Newmont's business four years ago, we continue to lead the gold sector in sustainability, profitable gold production and shareholder returns due to the strength of our team and the quality of our world-class
                  portfolio. During the first quarter, we delivered on our expected results, generated nearly $1.0 billion in adjusted EBITDA and returned $318 million to shareholders through our industry-leading dividend framework. We remain on track to
                  achieve our full year guidance ranges and build upon our track record of safely delivering long-term value to all of our stakeholders through sustainable and responsible mining." </p>
                <p> <b>- Tom Palmer, Newmont President and Chief Executive Officer</b> </p>

                <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
                  <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
                    <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
                </div>
                <table cellspacing="0" id="z0c4f15d6f7114c9fb1e45ba5a1b2489b" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; font-size: 10pt;">

                    <tr>
                      <td rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="3">

                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="3">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <i>**Gold equivalent ounces (GEOs) calculated using Gold ($1,400/oz.), Copper ($3.50/lb.), Silver ($20.00/oz.), Lead ($1.00/lb.) and Zinc ($1.20/lb.) pricing for 2023.</i> </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>

                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <i>****Expectations regarding 2023 dividend levels are forward-looking statements. The dividend framework is non-binding and an annualized dividend has not been declared by the
                            Board. The declaration and payment of future quarterly dividends remains at the discretion of the Board of Directors and will depend on the Company&#8217;s financial results, cash flow and cash requirements, future prospects, and
                            other factors deemed relevant by the Board. See cautionary statement at the end of this release.</i> </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>

                </table>
                <p> <b>FIRST QUARTER 2023 RESULTS DRIVERS</b> </p>
                <p> Production volumes came in line with our previously signaled expectations for the first quarter, with higher than signaled production at Tanami and Ahafo, partially offset by lower than planned production at our non-managed joint
                  ventures. Compared to the fourth quarter, earnings were in-line despite lower sales volumes, which were partially offset by higher realized gold prices, including $17 million of favorable mark-to-market adjustments on provisionally-priced
                  gold ounces. Gold CAS per ounce was higher than the fourth quarter due to lower sales volumes, partially offset by lower gross costs from easing inflation on commodities, materials and supplies. Advanced projects and exploration spend was
                  lower than the fourth quarter, but is expected to be higher in the second quarter and the remainder of the year. </p>
                <p> Cash flow from continuing operations was $481 million, which was lower than the fourth quarter due to lower sales volumes, partially offset by higher gold prices. Cash flow from continuing operations was also impacted by approximately
                  $360 million of unfavorable working capital movements, including $187 million of cash tax payments, approximately $170 million of build-up of stockpiles and finished goods inventory partially due to the timing of concentrate sales at
                  Pe&#241;asquito, and approximately $160 million in timing of payments on accrued liabilities which typically occurs in the first quarter. In addition, we reinvested $526 million in capital spend as we continue to progress our near-term
                  projects. </p>
                <p> <b>FIRST QUARTER 2023 FINANCIAL AND PRODUCTION SUMMARY</b> </p>
                <p> <b>Attributable gold production<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">1</sup></b> decreased 5 percent to 1,273 thousand ounces from the prior year quarter primarily due to lower mill recovery and ore grade milled at Pe&#241;asquito as a result of the planned mine
                  sequencing, the impact of the mill shutdown at Tanami due to the rainfall event and lower production at Nevada Gold Mines. These decreases were partially offset by higher ore grade milled at Ahafo and higher mill throughput and ore grade
                  milled at &#201;l&#233;onore. <b>Attributable gold sales versus production</b> was impacted by the timing of concentrate shipments at Pe&#241;asquito. This concentrate has been sold and the revenue will be realized in the second quarter. </p>
                <p> <b>Gold CAS</b> totaled $1.2 billion for the quarter.<b> Gold CAS per ounce<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">2</sup></b> increased 15 percent to $1,025 per ounce from the prior year quarter primarily due to lower gold sales volumes and higher direct operating
                  costs as a result of inflationary pressures, driven by higher labor costs and an increase in commodity input costs. </p>
                <p> <b>Gold AISC per ounce<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">2</sup></b> increased 19 percent to $1,376 per ounce from the prior year quarter primarily due to higher CAS per gold ounce and higher sustaining capital spend. </p>
                <p> <b>Attributable gold equivalent ounce (GEO) production from other metals</b> decreased 18 percent to 288 thousand ounces primarily due to lower mill recovery at Pe&#241;asquito. This decrease was partially offset by higher ore grade milled
                  at Boddington. <b>Attributable GEO sales versus production</b> was impacted by the timing of concentrate shipments at Pe&#241;asquito. This concentrate has been sold and the revenue will be realized in the second quarter. </p>

                <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
                  <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
                    <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
                </div>
                <p> <b>CAS from other metals</b> totaled $243 million for the quarter. <b>CAS per GEO<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">2</sup></b> increased 28 percent to $918 per ounce from the prior year quarter primarily due to lower other metal sales at Pe&#241;asquito, as well as
                  higher direct operating costs as a result of inflationary pressures, driven by higher labor costs and an increase in commodity input costs. </p>
                <p> <b>AISC per GEO<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">2</sup></b> increased 33 percent to $1,322 per ounce primarily due to higher CAS per GEO and higher sustaining capital spend. </p>
                <p> <b>Average realized gold price</b> was $1,906, an increase of $14 per ounce over the prior year quarter. Average realized gold price includes $1,901 per ounce of gross price received, a favorable impact of $14 per ounce mark-to-market
                  on provisionally-priced sales and reductions of $9 per ounce for treatment and refining charges. </p>
                <p> <b>Revenue </b>decreased 11 percent from the prior year quarter to $2.7 billion primarily due to lower sales volumes for all metals except copper and lower average realized co-product metal prices. </p>
                <p> <b>Net income from continuing operations attributable to Newmont stockholders </b>was $339 million or $0.42 per diluted share, a decrease of $93 million from the prior year quarter primarily due to lower sales volumes, lower average
                  realized co-product metal prices and higher CAS predominately resulting from cost inflation impacts. These decreases were partially offset by a non-cash pension settlement charge recognized in 2022, lower depreciation and amortization,
                  and the net gain of $36 million recognized on the exchange and subsequent sale of Triple Flag Precious Metals Corporation shares compared to the loss on the sale of the La Zanja equity method investment in 2022. </p>
                <p> <b>Adjusted net income<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">3</sup> </b>was $320 million or $0.40 per diluted share,<b> </b>compared to $546 million or $0.69 per diluted share in the prior year quarter. Primary adjustments to first quarter net income include changes
                  in the fair value of investments of $41 million and the net gain of $36 million recognized on the exchange and subsequent sale of Triple Flag Precious Metals Corporation shares, as well as valuation allowance and other tax adjustments. </p>
                <p> <b>Adjusted EBITDA<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">3</sup></b> decreased 29 percent to $1.0 billion for the quarter, compared to $1.4 billion for the prior year quarter. </p>
                <p> <b>Capital expenditures<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">4</sup></b> increased 20 percent from the prior year quarter to $526 million primarily due to higher sustaining capital spend. Development capital expenditures in 2023 primarily relate to Tanami Expansion 2,
                  Yanacocha Sulfides, Ahafo North, Pamour and Cerro Negro District Expansion 1. </p>
                <p> <b>Consolidated operating cash flow from continuing operations </b>decreased 30 percent from the prior year quarter to $481 million primarily due to a decrease in revenue due to lower sales volumes and lower average realized
                  co-product metal prices, an increase in operating cash expenditures resulting from the impacts of inflation on input costs and a build-up of inventory compared to the same period in 2022, primarily at Pe&#241;asquito. </p>
                <p> <b>Free Cash Flow<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">5</sup> </b>decreased to $(45) million from $252 million in the prior year quarter primarily due to lower operating cash flow and higher capital expenditures. </p>
                <p> <b>Balance sheet and liquidity </b>remained strong in the first quarter, ending the quarter with $2.7 billion of consolidated cash and $797 million of time deposits with a maturity of more than three months but less than one year,
                  with approximately $6.5 billion of total liquidity; reported net debt to adjusted EBITDA of 0.6x<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">6</sup>. </p>
                <p> <b>Nevada Gold Mines (NGM) </b>attributable gold production was 261 thousand ounces, with CAS of $1,109 per ounce<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">2</sup> and AISC of $1,405 per ounce<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">2</sup> for the first quarter. NGM EBITDA<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">6</sup> was $191 million. </p>
                <p> <b>Pueblo Viejo (PV) </b>attributable gold production was 60 thousand ounces for the quarter. Cash distributions received for the Company's equity method investment in Pueblo Viejo totaled $26 million in the first quarter. Capital
                  contributions of $36 million were made during the quarter related to the expansion project at Pueblo Viejo. </p>
                <table cellspacing="0" id="z13dbe23cd0c14c1e984e97c02faa0c0f" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; font-size: 10pt;">

                      </td>

                            ounces for the first quarter of 2022 from the Company&#8217;s equity method investment in Pueblo Viejo (40%).</i> </p>

                <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
                  <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
                    <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
                </div>
                <p> <b>Progressing Profitable Near-Term Projects from Unmatched Organic Pipeline</b> </p>
                <p> Newmont&#8217;s project pipeline supports stable production with improving margins and mine life<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">1</sup>. Newmont's 2023 and longer-term outlook includes current development capital costs and production related to Tanami Expansion 2,
                  Ahafo North, Pamour and Cerro Negro District Expansion 1. Development capital outlook for 2023 and 2024 includes spend related to the Yanacocha Sulfides project ahead of the investment decision planned for late 2024; additional
                  development capital spend and all metal production for Yanacocha Sulfides has been excluded from longer-term outlook beginning in 2025. </p>
                <p> Additional projects not listed below represent incremental improvements to the Company's outlook. </p>
                <ul style="list-style-type: disc;">
                  <li> <u>Tanami Expansion 2</u> (Australia) secures Tanami&#8217;s future as a long-life, low-cost producer by extending mine life beyond 2040 through the addition of a 1,460 meter hoisting shaft and supporting
                    infrastructure to process 3.3 million tonnes per year and provide a platform for future growth. The expansion is expected to increase average annual gold production by approximately 150,000 to 200,000 ounces per year for the first five
                    years and reduce operating costs by approximately 10 percent, bringing average all-in sustaining costs to $900 to $1,000 per ounce for Tanami (2026-2030). Commercial production for the project is expected in the second half of 2025.
                    Total capital costs are estimated to be between $1.2 and $1.3 billion. Development costs (excluding capitalized interest) since approval were $551 million, of which $52 million related to the three months ended March 31, 2023. </li>
                  <li> <u>Ahafo North</u> (Africa) expands our existing footprint in Ghana with four open pit mines and a stand-alone mill located approximately 30 kilometers from the Company&#8217;s Ahafo South operations. The project is
                    expected to add between 275,000 and 325,000 ounces per year with all-in sustaining costs of $800 to $900 per ounce for the first five full years of production. Ahafo North is the best unmined gold deposit in West Africa with
                    approximately 3.8 million ounces of Reserves and 1.4 million ounces of Measured, Indicated and Inferred Resources<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">2</sup> and significant upside potential to extend beyond Ahafo North&#8217;s current 13-year mine life. Commercial
                    production for the project is expected in the second half of 2025. Total capital costs are estimated to be between $950 and $1,050 million. Development costs (excluding capitalized interest) since approval were $254 million, of which
                    $42 million related to the three months ended March 31, 2023. </li>
                  <li> <u>Yanacocha Sulfides</u> (South America) will develop the first phase of sulfide deposits and an integrated processing circuit, including an autoclave to produce 45% gold, 45% copper and 10% silver. The first
                    phase focuses on developing the Yanacocha Verde and Chaquicocha deposits to extend Yanacocha&#8217;s operations beyond 2040 with second and third phases having the potential to extend life for multiple decades. In the third quarter of 2022,
                    Newmont announced the decision to delay the project in order to manage project execution risk, move out of a period of significant inflation and to balance development capital cash flows. Management continues to assess the execution and
                    project timeline, up to and including transitioning Yanacocha operations into full closure; the project remains subject to an investment decision. Development capital spend on the project is expected to be approximately $300 to $350
                    million per year in 2023 and 2024 related to advanced engineering, procurement and completing camp construction. </li>
                  <li> <u>Pamour</u> (North America) extends the life of Porcupine and maintains production beyond 2024. The project will optimize mill capacity, adding volume and supporting high grade ore from Borden and Hoyle Pond,
                    while supporting further exploration in a highly prospective and proven mining district. An investment decision is expected in late 2023 as opportunities have been identified to extend production from current operations, allowing for a
                    deferral of project spending. Formal updates to capital estimates and estimated project completion will be provided closer to the investment decision. </li>
                  <li> <u>Cerro Negro District Expansion 1</u> (South America) includes the simultaneous development of the Marianas and Eastern districts to extend the mine life of Cerro Negro beyond 2030. The project is expected to
                    improve production to above 350,000 ounces beginning in 2024 and provides a platform for further exploration and future growth through additional expansions. Development capital costs for the project are estimated to be between $350 and
                    $450 million. </li>
                </ul>
                <table cellspacing="0" id="zd1210080d4924bb4ba4ab801045096f5" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; font-size: 10pt;">

                      </td>

                            invasion of Ukraine, inflation, commodities and raw materials prices, supply chain disruptions, labor markets, engineering and mine plan assumptions, future funding decisions, consideration of strategic capital allocation and
                            other factors, which may impact estimated capital expenditures, AISC and timing of projects. See end of this release for cautionary statement regarding forward-looking statements.</i> </p>
                      </td>

                            See cautionary statement at the end of this release.</i> </p>

                  <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
                    <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
                </div>
                <p> <b>2023 Outlook Remains Second-Half Weighted as Previously Signaled</b> </p>
                <p> Newmont&#8217;s outlook reflects increasing gold production and ongoing investment into its operating assets and most promising growth prospects. Newmont's reserves and mine planning gold price assumption has been set at $1,400 per ounce.
                  2023 outlook assumes a $1,700 per ounce revenue gold price for CAS and AISC, including royalties and production taxes. For 2023, Newmont has assumed normalizing levels of inflation, improving throughout the year, with a year-over-year
                  average escalation rate of approximately 3%. </p>
                <p> Outlook includes development capital, costs and production related to Tanami Expansion 2, Ahafo North, Pamour and Cerro Negro District Expansion 1. Development capital outlook for 2023 and 2024 includes spend related to the Yanacocha
                  Sulfides project ahead of the investment decision planned for late 2024; additional development capital spend and all metal production for Yanacocha Sulfides has been excluded from longer-term outlook beginning in 2025. </p>
                <p> Please see the cautionary statement and footnotes for additional information. For a more detailed discussion, see the Company&#8217;s 2023 and Longer-Term Outlook released on February 23, 2023, available on www.newmont.com. </p>
                <p> <b>2023 SEASONALITY*</b> </p>

                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;border-left: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;vertical-align: bottom;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;width: 30%;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;"> 200 - 220 </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;border-left: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;vertical-align: bottom;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;width: 30%;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;"> 23% </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 40%;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> CC&amp;V </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;border-left: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;vertical-align: bottom;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;width: 30%;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;"> 160 - 180 </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;border-left: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;vertical-align: bottom;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;width: 30%;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;"> 21% </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>

                </table>
                <table cellspacing="0" id="z14ee48f2f0aa4682aea56f80c4bdf261" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; font-size: 10pt;">

                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <i>*Estimated 2023 seasonality remains subject to change and represents management&#8217;s expectations of future production results as of April 27, 2023.</i> </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>

                </table>
                <p> <b>In the second quarter of 2023, we expect to produce approximately 24 percent of our full year gold guidance</b>, primarily driven by the following sites: </p>
                <ul style="list-style-type: disc;">
                  <li> <b>Tanami -</b> Higher milling rates expected in the second quarter, with continued recovery from the first quarter rainfall event </li>
                  <li> <b>Boddington - </b>Higher grades expected in the second quarter; stripping expected to begin in the second half of the year </li>
                  <li> <b>Ahafo - </b>Higher grades expected in the second quarter due to the planned mine sequence and the progression of work at Subika Underground </li>
                  <li> <b>Akyem -</b> Higher grades expected in the second quarter due to the planned mine sequence </li>
                  <li> <b>Pe&#241;asquito - </b>Lower production expected in the second quarter due to the planned mine sequence resulting in lower grades from the Chile Colorado pit </li>
                </ul>
                <p> <b>We expect to deliver approximately 55 percent of our full year gold production guidance in the second half of the year.</b> </p>

                </div>

                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;border-top: solid black 1pt;border-left: solid black 1pt;width: 55%;">

                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;border-top: solid black 1pt;border-left: solid black 1pt;border-right: solid black 1pt;width: 45%;">
                        <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <b>2023E</b> </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 55%;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Exploration &amp; Advanced Projects </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 45%;">
                        <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> $475 - $525 </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 55%;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> General &amp; Administrative </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 45%;">
                        <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> $260 - $290 </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 55%;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Interest Expense </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 45%;">
                        <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> $200 - $220 </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 55%;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Depreciation &amp; Amortization </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 45%;">
                        <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> $2,200 - $2,400 </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 55%;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Adjusted Tax Rate <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">a,b</sup> </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;width: 45%;">
                        <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> 32% - 36% </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>

                </table>
                <table cellspacing="0" id="z6f11f7bdd3164d4a8b383e9e9a1a1b64" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; font-size: 10pt;">

                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <i><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">a</sup></i><i> The adjusted tax rate excludes certain items such as tax valuation allowance adjustments.</i> </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <i><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">b</sup></i><i> Assuming average prices of $1,700 per ounce for gold, $3.50 per pound for copper, $20.00 per ounce for silver, $0.90 per pound for lead, and $1.35 per pound
                            for zinc and achievement of current production, sales and cost estimates, we estimate our consolidated adjusted effective tax rate related to continuing operations for 2023 will be between 32%-36%.</i> </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>

                </table>

                <p> Assuming a 35% incremental tax rate, a $100 per ounce increase in gold price would deliver an expected $400 million improvement in attributable free cash flow. Included within the attributable free cash flow sensitivity is a royalty and
                  production tax impact of $5 per ounce for every $100 per ounce change in gold price. </p>

                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;vertical-align: bottom;width: 15%;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;">

                      </td>

                <table cellspacing="0" id="zf411e5a9f88e4739a4bf67e41768dbaa" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; font-size: 10pt;">

                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">a</sup> 2023 outlook projections are considered forward-looking statements and represent management&#8217;s good faith estimates or expectations of future production results as of
                          February 23, 2023. Outlook is based upon certain assumptions, including, but not limited to, metal prices, oil prices, certain exchange rates and other assumptions. For example, 2023 Outlook assumes $1,700/oz Au, $3.50/lb Cu,
                          $20.00/oz Ag, $1.35/lb Zn, $0.90/lb Pb, $0.70 USD/AUD exchange rate, $0.77 USD/CAD exchange rate and $90/barrel WTI. Production, CAS, AISC and capital estimates exclude projects that have not yet been approved, except for
                          Yanacocha Sulfides, Pamour and Cerro Negro District Expansion 1 which are included in Outlook. The potential impact on inventory valuation as a result of lower prices, input costs, and project decisions are not included as part of
                          this Outlook. Assumptions used for purposes of Outlook may prove to be incorrect and actual results may differ from those anticipated, including variation beyond a +/-5% range. Outlook cannot be guaranteed. As such, investors are
                          cautioned not to place undue reliance upon Outlook and forward-looking statements as there can be no assurance that the plans, assumptions or expectations upon which they are placed will occur. Amounts may not recalculate to
                          totals due to rounding. See cautionary at the end of this release. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">b </sup>All-in sustaining costs (AISC) as used in the Company&#8217;s Outlook is a non-GAAP metric; see below for further information and reconciliation to consolidated 2023 CAS
                          outlook. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">c </sup>Consolidated production for Merian is presented on a total production basis for the mine site; attributable production represents a 75% interest for Merian. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">d </sup>Represents the ownership interest in the Nevada Gold Mines (NGM) joint venture. NGM is owned 38.5% by Newmont and owned 61.5% and operated by Barrick. The Company
                          accounts for its interest in NGM using the proportionate consolidation method, thereby recognizing its pro-rata share of the assets, liabilities and operations of NGM. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">e </sup>Attributable production includes Newmont&#8217;s 40% interest in Pueblo Viejo, which is accounted for as an equity method investment. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>

                      </td>

                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">

Attributable gold ounces produced at Pueblo Viejo
                          are not included in attributable gold ounces sold, as noted in footnote 1. Income and expenses of equity method investments are included in <i>Equity income (loss) of affiliates.</i> </p>

                <p> <b>Non-GAAP Financial Measures</b> </p>
                <p> Non-GAAP financial measures are intended to provide additional information only and do not have any standard meaning prescribed by GAAP. These measures should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of performance
                  prepared in accordance with GAAP. Refer to Non-GAAP Financial Measures within Part II, Item 7 within our Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2022, filed with the SEC on February 23, 2023 for further information on the non-GAAP
                  financial measures presented below, including why management believes that its presentation of non-GAAP financial measures provides useful information to investors. </p>

                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(1)</sup> </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Per share measures may not recalculate due to rounding. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(2)</sup> </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Change in fair value of investments, included in <i>Other income (loss), net</i>, primarily represents unrealized gains and losses related to the Company's investment in current and
                          non-current marketable and other equity securities. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(3)</sup> </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> (Gain) loss on asset and investment sales, net, included in <i>Other income (loss), net</i>, primarily represents the net gain recognized on the exchange of the previously held
                          Maverix investment for Triple Flag and the subsequent sale of the Triple Flag investment. Refer to Note 10 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements for further information. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(4)</sup> </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Impairment charges, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, represents non-cash write-downs of various assets that are no longer in use and materials and supplies inventories. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(5)</sup> </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Restructuring and severance, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, primarily represents severance and related costs associated with significant organizational or operating model
                          changes implemented by the Company. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(6)</sup> </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Other represents income received on the favorable settlement of certain matters that were outstanding at the time of sale of the related investment in 2022. Amounts included in <i>Other
                            income (loss), net</i>. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(7)</sup> </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> The tax effect of adjustments, included in <i>Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</i>, represents the tax effect of adjustments in footnotes (2) through (6), as described above,
                          and are calculated using the applicable regional tax rate. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(8)</sup> </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Valuation allowance and other tax adjustments, included in<i> Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</i>, is recorded for items such as foreign tax credits, capital losses,
                          disallowed foreign losses, and the effects of changes in foreign currency exchange rates on deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities. The adjustment for the three months ended March 31, 2023 reflects the net increase or
                          (decrease) to net operating losses, capital losses, tax credit carryovers, and other deferred tax assets subject to valuation allowance of $10, the effects of changes in foreign exchange rates on deferred tax assets and
                          liabilities of $17, net reductions to the reserve for uncertain tax positions of $11, other tax adjustments of $2. For further information on reductions to the reserve for uncertain tax positions, refer to Note 8 of the Condensed
                          Consolidated Financial Statements. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(9)</sup> </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Adjusted net income (loss) per diluted share is calculated using diluted common shares in accordance with GAAP. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>

                      </td>

                          and are calculated using the applicable regional tax rate. </p>

                          credits, capital losses, disallowed foreign losses, and the effects of changes in foreign currency exchange rates on deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities. The adjustment for the three months ended March 31, 2022
                          reflects the net increase or (decrease) to net operating losses, capital losses, tax credit carryovers, and other deferred tax assets subject to valuation allowance of $12, the effects of changes in foreign exchange rates on
                          deferred tax assets and liabilities of $(3), net reductions to the reserve for uncertain tax positions of $(12), and other tax adjustments of $1. </p>

                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(1)</sup> </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Change in fair value of investments, included in <i>Other income (loss), net</i>, primarily represents unrealized gains and losses related to the Company's investments in current and
                          non-current marketable and other equity securities. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(2)</sup> </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> (Gain) loss on asset and investment sales, net, included in <i>Other income (loss), net, </i>in 2023 is primarily comprised of the net gain recognized on the exchange of the
                          previously held Maverix investment for Triple Flag and the subsequent sale of the Triple Flag investment. Refer to Note 10 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements for further information. For 2022, primarily comprised
                          of the loss recognized on the sale of the La Zanja equity method investment. Refer to Note 1 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements for further information. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(3)</sup> </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Impairment charges, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, represents non-cash write-downs of various assets that are no longer in use and materials and supplies inventories. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(4)</sup> </p>

                      </td>

                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Restructuring and severance, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, primarily represents severance and related costs associated with significant organizational or operating model
                          changes implemented by the Company for all periods presented. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(5)</sup> </p>

                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Pension settlement, included in<i> Other income (loss), net</i>, represents pension settlement charges in 2022 related to the annuitization of certain defined benefit plans. For
                          further information, refer to Note 7 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(6)</sup> </p>

                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Settlement costs, included in <i>Other expense, net,</i> are primarily comprised of a legal settlement and a voluntary contribution made to support humanitarian efforts in Ukraine in
                          2022. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">

                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Reclamation and remediation charges, included in <i>Reclamation and remediation</i>, represent revisions to reclamation and remediation plans at the Company's former operating
                          properties and historic mining operations that have entered the closure phase and have no substantive future economic value. For further information, refer to Note 5 of the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">

                          in 2022. Amounts included in <i>Other income (loss), net</i>. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>

                <p> <b><i>Free Cash Flow</i></b> </p>
                <p> The following table sets forth a reconciliation of Free Cash Flow to <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</i>, which the Company believes to be the GAAP financial measure most directly comparable to Free Cash Flow, as
                  well as information regarding <i>Net cash provided by (used in) investing activities</i> and <i>Net cash provided by (used in) financing activities.</i> </p>

                <table cellspacing="0" id="zfef4ccbe34a24641b9f7f4a070dd58d5" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; font-size: 10pt;">

                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">

                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <i>Net cash provided by (used in) investing activities </i>includes<i> Additions to property, plant and mine development,</i> which is included in the Company&#8217;s computation of Free
                          Cash Flow.&#8203; </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>

                </table>
                <p> <b><i>Attributable Free Cash Flow</i></b> </p>
                <p> Management uses Attributable Free Cash Flow as a non-GAAP measure to analyze cash flows generated from operations that are attributable to the Company. Attributable Free Cash Flow is <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating
                    activities</i> after deducting net cash flows from operations attributable to noncontrolling interests less <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities of discontinued operations</i> after deducting net cash flows from
                  discontinued operations attributable to noncontrolling interests less <i>Additions to property, plant and mine development</i> after deducting property, plant and mine development attributable to noncontrolling interests. The Company
                  believes that Attributable Free Cash Flow is useful as one of the bases for comparing the Company&#8217;s performance with its competitors. Although Attributable Free Cash Flow and similar measures are frequently used as measures of cash flows
                  generated from operations by other companies, the Company&#8217;s calculation of Attributable Free Cash Flow is not necessarily comparable to such other similarly titled captions of other companies. </p>
                <p> The presentation of non-GAAP Attributable Free Cash Flow is not meant to be considered in isolation or as an alternative to Net income attributable to Newmont stockholders as an indicator of the Company&#8217;s performance, or as an
                  alternative to <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</i> as a measure of liquidity as those terms are defined by GAAP, and does not necessarily indicate whether cash flows will be sufficient to fund cash needs. The
                  Company&#8217;s definition of Attributable Free Cash Flow is limited in that it does not represent residual cash flows available for discretionary expenditures due to the fact that the measure does not deduct the payments required for debt
                  service and other contractual obligations or payments made for business acquisitions. Therefore, the Company believes it is important to view Attributable Free Cash Flow as a measure that provides supplemental information to the Company&#8217;s
                  Condensed Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows. </p>
                <p> The following tables set forth a reconciliation of Attributable Free Cash Flow, a non-GAAP financial measure, to <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</i>, which the Company believes to be the GAAP financial measure
                  most directly comparable to Attributable Free Cash Flow, as well as information regarding <i>Net cash provided by (used in) investing activities</i> and <i>Net cash provided by (used in) financing activities.</i> </p>
                <table cellspacing="0" id="zddc284c244314803842cb333c9bfeeff" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto;width: 100%; font-size: 10pt;">

                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;padding-left: 0px;width: 61%;">

                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;padding-left: 0px;width: 1%;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> &#160; </p>
                      </td>
                      <td rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="11">
                        <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <b>Three Months Ended March 31, 2023</b> </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;padding-left: 0px;width: 61%;">

                      </td>

                      </td>
                      <td rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;" colspan="3">
                        <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <b>Consolidated</b> </p>

                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(1)</sup> </p>

                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Adjustment to eliminate a portion of<i> Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</i>, <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities of discontinued operations </i>and
                          <i>Additions to property, plant and mine development</i> attributable to noncontrolling interests, which relates to Merian (25%). </p>

                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(2)</sup> </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> For the three months ended March 31, 2023, Merian had total consolidated <i>Additions to property, plant and mine development</i> of $13 on a cash basis. </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">

                          Cash Flow.&#8203; </p>

                          Cash Flow.&#8203; </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>

                </table>
                <p> <b><i>Net Debt</i></b> </p>
                <p> Net Debt is calculated as <i>Debt</i> and <i>Lease and other financing obligations</i> less <i>Cash and cash equivalents</i> and time deposits included in <i>Time deposits and other investments</i>, as presented on the Condensed
                  Consolidated Balance Sheets. <i>Cash and cash equivalents </i>and time deposits are subtracted from <i>Debt</i> and <i>Lease and other financing obligations </i>as these are highly liquid, low-risk investments and could be used to
                  reduce the Company's debt obligations. </p>
                <p> The following table sets forth a reconciliation of Net Debt, a non-GAAP financial measure, to <i>Debt</i> and <i>Lease and other financing obligations</i>, which the Company believes to be the GAAP financial measures most directly
                  comparable to Net Debt. </p>
                <table cellspacing="0" id="zc3ed1327c8524f2ea0331cca6a4f4b4d" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto;width: 100%; font-size: 10pt;">

                <p> <b><i>Costs applicable to sales per ounce/gold equivalent ounce</i></b> </p>
                <p> <i>Costs applicable to sales </i>per ounce/gold equivalent ounce are calculated by dividing the costs applicable to sales of gold and other metals by gold ounces or gold equivalent ounces sold, respectively. These measures are
                  calculated for the periods presented on a consolidated basis. </p>
                <p> The following tables reconcile these non-GAAP measures to the most directly comparable GAAP measures. </p>
                <table cellspacing="0" id="z376bf603aabd4b8396453ff035d13760" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto;width: 100%; font-size: 10pt;">

                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <b><i>Costs applicable to sales per gold ounce</i></b> </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;"><br>
                      </td>
                      <td rowspan="1" colspan="7" style="padding-left: 0px;"><br>
                      </td>
                    </tr>

                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Gold equivalent ounces is calculated as pounds or ounces produced multiplied by the ratio of the other metals price to the gold price, using Gold ($1,400/oz.), Copper ($3.50/lb.),
                          Silver ($20.00/oz.), Lead ($1.00/lb.) and Zinc ($1.20/lb.) pricing for 2023 and Gold ($1,200/oz.), Copper ($3.25/lb.), Silver ($23.00/oz.), Lead ($0.95/lb.) and Zinc ($1.15/lb.) pricing for 2022. </p>
                      </td>

                <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
                  <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
                    <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
                </div>
                <p> <b><i>All-In Sustaining Costs</i></b> </p>
                <p> All-in sustaining costs represent the sum of certain costs, recognized as GAAP financial measures, that management considers to be associated with production. All-in sustaining costs per ounce amounts are calculated by dividing all-in
                  sustaining costs by gold ounces or gold equivalent ounces sold. </p>
                <table cellspacing="0" id="zb70257b75cef4e04b95aad58630d460e" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto;width: 100%; font-size: 10pt;">

                  as amended, and Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, which are intended to be covered by the safe harbor created by such sections and other applicable laws. </p>

                <p> <b><i>Net debt to Adjusted EBITDA ratio</i></b> </p>
                <p> Management uses net debt to Adjusted EBITDA as non-GAAP measures to evaluate the Company&#8217;s operating performance, including our ability to generate earnings sufficient to service our debt. Net debt to Adjusted EBITDA represents the
                  ratio of the Company&#8217;s debt, net of cash and cash equivalents and time deposits, to Adjusted EBITDA. Net debt to Adjusted EBITDA does not represent, and should not be considered an alternative to, net income (loss), operating income
                  (loss), or cash flow from operations as those terms are defined by GAAP, and does not necessarily indicate whether cash flows will be sufficient to fund cash needs. Although Net Debt to Adjusted EBITDA and similar measures are frequently
                  used as measures of operations and the ability to meet debt service requirements by other companies, our calculation of net debt to Adjusted EBITDA measure is not necessarily comparable to such other similarly titled captions of other
                  companies. The Company believes that net debt to Adjusted EBITDA provides useful information to investors and others in understanding and evaluating our operating results in the same manner as our management and Board of Directors.
                  Management&#8217;s determination of the components of net debt to Adjusted EBITDA is evaluated periodically and based, in part, on a review of non-GAAP financial measures used by mining industry analysts. Net income (loss) attributable to
                  Newmont stockholders is reconciled to Adjusted EBITDA as follows: </p>

                <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
                  <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">

                </div>

                <p> <b><i>Net average realized price per ounce/ pound</i></b> </p>
                <p> Average realized price per ounce/ pound are non-GAAP financial measures. The measures are calculated by dividing the net consolidated gold, copper, silver, lead and zinc sales by the consolidated gold ounces, copper pounds, silver
                  ounces, lead pounds and zinc pounds sold, respectively. These measures are calculated on a consistent basis for the periods presented on a consolidated basis. Average realized price per ounce/ pound statistics are intended to provide
                  additional information only, do not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of performance prepared in accordance with GAAP. The measures are not
                  necessarily indicative of operating profit or cash flow from operations as determined under GAAP. Other companies may calculate these measures differently. </p>
                <p> The following tables reconcile these non-GAAP measures to the most directly comparable GAAP measure: </p>
                <table cellspacing="0" id="z00513242878f4491873b97f0078767b4" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto;width: 100%; font-size: 10pt;">

                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;padding-left: 0px;width: 74%;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> &#160; </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;padding-left: 0px;width: 1%;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> &#160; </p>
                      </td>
                      <td rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;" colspan="7">
                        <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <b>Three Months Ended </b><br>
                          <b>March 31,</b> </p>
                      </td>

                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Per ounce/pound measures may not recalculate due to rounding.&#8203; </p>
                      </td>

                </table>
                <p> <b><i>Gold by-product metrics</i></b> </p>
                <p> Copper, silver, lead and zinc are by-products often obtained during the process of extracting and processing the primary ore-body. In our GAAP Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements, the value of these by-products is recorded as a
                  credit to our CAS and the value of the primary ore is recorded as Sales. In certain instances, copper, silver, lead and zinc are co-products, or a significant resource in the primary ore-body, and the revenue is recorded as Sales in our
                  GAAP Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements. </p>

                <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
                  <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
                    <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
                </div>
                <p> Gold by-product metrics are non-GAAP financial measures that serve as a basis for comparing the Company&#8217;s performance with certain competitors. As Newmont&#8217;s operations are primarily focused on gold production, &#8220;Gold by-product metrics&#8221;
                  were developed to allow investors to view Sales, CAS per ounce and AISC per ounce calculations that classify all copper, silver, lead and zinc production as a by-product, even when copper, silver, lead or zinc is a significant resource in
                  the primary ore-body. These metrics are calculated by subtracting copper, silver, lead and zinc sales recognized from Sales and including these amounts as offsets to CAS. </p>
                <p> Gold by-product metrics are calculated on a consistent basis for the periods presented on a consolidated basis. These metrics are intended to provide supplemental information only, do not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP
                  and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of performance prepared in accordance with GAAP. Other companies may calculate these measures differently as a result of differences in the underlying accounting
                  principles, policies applied and in accounting frameworks, such as in IFRS. </p>
                <p> The following tables reconcile these non-GAAP measures to the most directly comparable GAAP measures: </p>
                <table cellspacing="0" id="z9c024041ed9f4cb89805e632750def94" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto;width: 100%; font-size: 10pt;">

                    <tr>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;padding-left: 0px;width: 74%;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> &#160; </p>
                      </td>
                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;padding-left: 0px;width: 1%;">
                        <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> &#160; </p>
                      </td>
                      <td rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;padding-left: 0px;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;" colspan="7">
                        <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <b>Three Months Ended <br>
                          </b><b>March 31,</b> </p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>

                      <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;padding-left: 0px;width: 74%;">

                <p> <u>Webcast Details</u> </p>
                <p> Title: Newmont First Quarter 2023 Earnings Conference Call <br>
                  URL: https://events.q4inc.com/attendee/766392509 </p>
                <p> The first quarter 2023 results will be available before the market opens on Thursday, April 27, 2023, on the &#8220;Investor Relations&#8221; section of the Company&#8217;s website, www.newmont.com. Additionally, the conference call will be archived for
                  a limited time on the Company&#8217;s website. </p>
                <p> <b>About Newmont</b> </p>
                <p> Newmont is the world&#8217;s leading gold company and a producer of copper, silver, lead and zinc. The Company&#8217;s world-class portfolio of assets, prospects and talent is anchored in favorable mining jurisdictions in North America, South
                  America, Australia and Africa. Newmont is the only gold producer listed in the S&amp;P 500 Index and is widely recognized for its principled environmental, social and governance practices. The Company is an industry leader in value
                  creation, supported by robust safety standards, superior execution and technical expertise. Newmont was founded in 1921 and has been publicly traded since 1925. </p>

                <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
                  <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
